poem:
A President's Chronicle  

In twenty nights  
of narrow corridors—  
the pen scratches,  
echoes beneath concrete.  

Columns of words  
march relentless—  
cries of innocence  
climb the paper walls.  

Barred shadows flicker—  
fragments of power  
shed their weight,  
telling tales  
between the bars  
of familiar solitude.  

Freedom waits—  
a distant echo  
or a dream?
